Package pl.edu.pwr.student.UI.Blocks

Class Drawable

java.lang.Object
pl.edu.pwr.student.UI.Blocks.Drawable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CompoundElement, UiElement
public abstract class Drawable extends Object
Represents a element that can be interacted with by the user.

  • Constructor Details

    • Drawable

      public Drawable(String type, Canvas s, processing.core.PVector v, UiAvailable uiElem, float rotation)
      Creates a new UI element object with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      type - The name of the UI element.
      s - The Processing sketch used to render the UI element.
      v - The position of the UI element on the canvas, specified as a PVector object.
      uiElem - The gate represented by the UI element, specified as a UiAvailable object.
      rotation - The rotation of the UI element, specified as a float.

      The UiElement constructor creates a new UI element object with the specified properties. The type parameter specifies the name of the UI element, such as "button" or "checkbox". The s parameter specifies the Processing sketch used to render the UI element. The v parameter specifies the position of the UI element on the canvas, as a PVector object with x and y coordinates. The uiElem parameter specifies the gate represented by the UI element, as a UiAvailable object.

    • Drawable

      public Drawable(JSONAvailable jsonAvailable, Canvas s)
      Creates a new UI element from JSONAvaible object
      Parameters:
      jsonAvailable - Object created from file
      s - The Processing sketch used to render the UI element.

      The UiElement constructor creates a new UI element object with the specified properties. The jsonAvailable is a middle version of object between JSON string and UIElement. The s parameter specifies the Processing sketch used to render the UI element. If JSONAvaible has bad name throw exception.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public abstract void run()
      Renders the UI element on the canvas and displays any connected signals.

      The run method is responsible for rendering the UI element on the canvas and displaying any connected signals. First, it checks whether the mouse is currently hovering over the element and, if so, fills the element with a dark color to indicate that it is active. Next, it renders the shape of the element using the ShapeLoader class. If the element is a Switch, it displays either the "true" or "false" state of the switch using a specific shape for each state. If the element is an LED and its state is "on", it displays a circle in the specified color. Finally, it iterates through each of the element's output signals and draws a line to each connected element to indicate the signal flow.

    • over

      public boolean over(processing.core.PVector v)
      Determines whether the mouse is currently over the element.
      Parameters:
      v - the mouse position as a PVector
      Returns:
      true if the mouse is over the element, false otherwise

    • rotate

      public void rotate(int direction)
      changes the rotation of the element by the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      direction - higher than 0 if rotate right, lower than 0 if rotate left

    • updatePosition

      public abstract void updatePosition(processing.core.PVector pVector)
      Updates the position of the element.
      Parameters:
      pVector - the new position of the element as a PVector
